arm_group.description: Rehabilitation of missing teeth with Dental Implant (MIS Technologies)

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of the present study is to evaluate the 1-year and 3-year survival and success of
      MIS® C1 implants with a length of 10-15mm.

      Specific Aims

        1. To study 1-year and 3-year implant survival rate C1 implants

        2. To study 1-year and 3-year implant bone level changes of C1 implants

clinical_study.brief_title: Survival and Success of MIS C1 Implants- a Field Study
clinical_study.condition: Failure of Osseointegration of Dental Implant

detailed_description.textblock:
10 implants will be allocated to each of the twelve dentists, for a total of 120 implants.
      One test implant per patient will be allowed into the study for a total of 120 patients.

      The following data will be collected for each patient/implant:

        1. Patient data including birthdate, health, surgery date.

        2. Implant length, diameter

        3. Insertion torque

        4. Periapical radiographs (at insertion, and twelve months post surgery).

        5. Post operative complications and adverse events.

        6. Periodontal data around Ramfjord teeth (16, 21, 24, 36, 41, 44) : Plaque index,
           Gingival Index, Probing depth in six sites and Bleeding on probing in six sites, at
           baseline and twelve months post surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          1. Age between 18-75.

          2. Patient expresses his wish to restore the missing tooth/teeth with implant therapy.

          3. Partial edentulism with available bone height for dental implants ≥ 10mm mm.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          1. Contraindicating medical conditions such as uncontrolled diabetes, untreated
             malignancies, pregnancy, previous/current bisphosphonate therapy.

          2. Untreated periodontal disease, untreated caries, PA pathology in contact with the
             location of the perspective implant.

          3. Major bone augmentation in conjunction with implant placement. Localised bone
             augmentation in conjunction with implant placement, of up to 3 mm on 1-2 aspects of
             the implant will be allowed.

          4. One stage immediate loading/restoration.

intervention.description: MIS Technologies Ltd. C1 Dental implants

clinical_study.official_title: Survival and Success of MIS C1 Implants- a Field Study

primary_outcome.measure: To study 1  and 3 year implant survival rate C1 implants

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014

secondary_outcome.measure: To study 1 and 3 year implant bone level changes of C1 implants
